text: Do you work from code examples and snippets?
How do you organize them?
Find them?
Succint version:
Do you have any suggestions about a repository where I can collect valuable C# / SQL / JavaScript / jQuery snippets and examples - and find them later?
If so, please forward me a link!
Loquacious version:
I have a crappy memory.
Did I mention that already?
Stop me if I repeat myself.
Stop me if I repeat myself.
I've had to invent ways to compensate for my poor recall.
In a former life, my development environment provided a way to write a longish comment about each object in the app, which was stored in the library with the object.
I wrote a lot of methods, and each had a comment describing the method's purpose.
I created a tool that allowed me to search through those comments, presenting matching methods in a list.
If the method name didn't suffice, I could double-click to see the source code.
All my methods had a header that explained what it did and how it worked, and provided a usage example or two.
Once found, it was easy to apply.
Select the usage example, copy and paste into whatever you're coding, and alter the details to fit.
This made my working life work.
I encapsulated the tricky stuff in methods and had a means to find them -- when my crappy memory (did I mention that already?
) failed me.
Now I'm in .NET, and objects have no convenient place for a descriptive comment, unless I embed them in the source.
I've seen numberless code snippets in books and web sites that I have never captured and cannot reproduce.
Sigh.
Do you retain and organize code snippets, so you can refer to them later?
If so, how?
Do you have a code repository of some kind?
How do you keep track of those useful examples?
I'm on the verge of undertaking to write my own repository, to keep track of the fabulous C#, SQL, jQuery code, etc that I create or come across.
Seriously.
If there are sites or applications that makes it easy to save examples and snippets, tag them perhaps, and FIND them later -- please post the link.
Thanks, Hoytster
